report_title: Big Hat Group Weekly Security Update Report
report_description: The Weekly Security Update Report is provided by Big Hat Group with the goal of making it easier to find the information System Administrators and Security Professionals need to keep their systems secure. The CVE Weekly Report is provided as a beta resource.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36559 Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Spoofing Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is affected by a Spoofing Vulnerability identified as CVE-2023-36559, with a low severity base score of 4.2. The vulnerability requires user interaction, where the user needs to click on a specially crafted URL to be compromised by the attacker. Successful exploitation could lead to minor loss of confidentiality and integrity, with no availability impact. An attacker would need to combine this with other vulnerabilities to perform an attack. Microsoft has released a security update for Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) with the build number 118.0.2088.46, addressing this vulnerability. System administrators are advised to apply the security update to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information, refer to the Microsoft Support Lifecycle page.

section_1_data.title: Chromium: CVE-2023-5478 Inappropriate implementation in Autofill
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is affected by an inappropriate implementation vulnerability in Autofill, identified as CVE-2023-5478. This vulnerability was assigned by Chrome and is addressed by ingesting Chromium. The latest version of Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) with build number 118.0.2088.46 is no longer vulnerable. The vulnerability is caused by a flaw in the Chromium Open Source Software (OSS) consumed by Microsoft Edge. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code in the context of the current user. Microsoft has provided a solution by releasing a security update for Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) with the build number 118.0.2088.46. System administrators are advised to update their Microsoft Edge installations to the latest version to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information, refer to the [Google Chrome Releases](https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2023) page.
section_1_data.symptoms: The vulnerability manifests as an inappropriate implementation in the Autofill feature of Chromium, which is used by Microsoft Edge.
section_1_data.fixes: The fix for this vulnerability is to update to the latest version of Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based), which is no longer vulnerable.
section_1_data.tools: The tool to check the version of the browser is the 'About Microsoft Edge' section, which can be accessed by clicking on the 3 dots (...) on the very right-hand side of the window, then clicking on 'Help and Feedback', and finally on 'About Microsoft Edge'.

Microsoft has addressed this vulnerability by ingesting Chromium, and the latest version of Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is no longer vulnerable. System administrators are advised to ensure that their Microsoft Edge installations are updated to the latest version to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information, refer to the Google Chrome Releases page. The vulnerability affects Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) with the build number 118.0.2088.46, released on 13th October 2023. Microsoft acknowledges the efforts of the security community in coordinated vulnerability disclosure and recommends checking the Microsoft Support Lifecycle for software support lifecycle information.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-44487 MITRE: CVE-2023-44487 HTTP/2 Rapid Reset Attack
section_1_data.summary: The CVE-2023-44487 vulnerability affects various Microsoft products, including Windows Server, Windows 10, Windows 11, ASP.NET Core, Microsoft Visual Studio, and .NET. It is a Denial of Service (DoS) vulnerability with a maximum severity of Important. The vulnerability is related to the HTTP/2 protocol and can be exploited to cause a DoS condition. Microsoft has provided workarounds to mitigate the risk, including disabling the HTTP/2 protocol on web servers using Registry Editor and limiting applications to HTTP1.1 via configuration settings for Kestrel endpoints. It's crucial to install the security updates for the affected products as soon as possible. The impact of exploitation could lead to service unavailability, affecting the availability and reliability of web services and applications. System administrators should carefully follow the provided workarounds, considering the potential risks associated with Registry Editor modifications. Microsoft has released security updates for the affected products, addressing the vulnerability and providing protection against potential exploitation.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36563 Microsoft WordPad Information Disclosure Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft WordPad is affected by an information disclosure vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-36563, with a CVSS score of 6.5/5.9. The vulnerability allows the disclosure of NTLM hashes and requires user interaction, where an attacker must send a malicious file and convince the user to open it. This vulnerability impacts various Windows versions, including Windows Server 2008, 2016, 2019, and Windows 10. Microsoft has released security updates for the affected systems to address this vulnerability. System administrators are advised to apply the provided security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information and to download the security updates, refer to the Microsoft Security Update Guide.
section_1_data.symptoms: The vulnerability allows for information disclosure through a network attack vector. The attacker can exploit the vulnerability remotely, and the attack is exploitable at the protocol level one or more network hops away.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36581 Microsoft Message Queuing Denial of Service Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Message Queuing is affected by a Denial of Service vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-36581, with a CVSS score of 7.5. The vulnerability allows an attacker to exploit the network-bound component without user interaction, resulting in a total loss of availability. The impact affects various Windows Server versions, Windows 10, and Windows 11, potentially disrupting critical services. Microsoft has provided a security update to address this vulnerability, available as monthly rollup or security-only updates for the affected platforms. System administrators are advised to apply the official fix promptly to mitigate the risk of exploitation and ensure the availability of the impacted components. For more information and specific build numbers, refer to the Microsoft Security Update Guide.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36575 Microsoft Message Queuing Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Message Queuing is affected by a remote code execution vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-36575, with a CVSS score of 7.3. The vulnerability allows an authenticated domain user to remotely execute code on the target server, potentially leading to a total loss of confidentiality, integrity, and availability. The attack vector is local, requiring user interaction, and the attacker needs to convince a user to connect to a malicious server or compromise a legitimate MSMQ server host. Microsoft has provided a solution by releasing security updates for various Windows Server versions, including Windows Server 2012, 2008, and 2016, as well as Windows 10 and 11. System administrators are advised to apply the relevant security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. Additionally, enabling the Windows message queuing service can make a system exploitable by this vulnerability, and this feature can be added via the Control Panel.
section_1_data.symptoms: Successful exploitation of this vulnerability requires a user to take some action before the vulnerability can be exploited.
section_1_data.fixes: The fix for this vulnerability is currently unpatched. Users are advised to monitor Microsoft's official channels for updates regarding this vulnerability.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36576 Windows Kernel Information Disclosure Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: A Windows Kernel Information Disclosure Vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-36576, has been disclosed with a base score of 5.5 and a temporal score of 4.8. The vulnerability allows an attacker to disclose device information like resource IDs, SAS tokens, and user properties. It has a low attack complexity and requires low privileges, enabling any authenticated attacker to trigger it without admin or elevated privileges. The vulnerability affects various Windows versions, including Windows 10, Windows 11, and Windows Server 2016/2019/2022. Microsoft has provided security updates for all affected platforms, addressing the vulnerability and mitigating the risk of information disclosure. System administrators are advised to apply the provided security updates to ensure the protection of their systems and prevent potential exploitation.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36577 Microsoft WDAC OLE DB provider for SQL Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft has released a security update to address the CVE-2023-36577 vulnerability, impacting the Microsoft WDAC OLE DB provider for SQL Server. This vulnerability allows remote code execution with a maximum severity of 'Important.' The attack vector is network-based, requiring user interaction, and has a low attack complexity. Successful exploitation could lead to a total loss of confidentiality, integrity, and availability. An attacker could trick an authenticated victim into connecting to a malicious SQL database, allowing the execution of arbitrary code within the context of the user's SQL client application. Microsoft has provided an official fix for this vulnerability, and system administrators are advised to apply the security update to mitigate the risk of exploitation. The security update is available for various Windows Server versions, Windows 10, and Windows 11. It's crucial for system administrators to prioritize and apply the update to affected systems to ensure protection against potential remote code execution attacks.
section_1_data.products: Microsoft WDAC OLE DB provider for SQL Server
section_1_data.symptoms: Successful exploitation of this vulnerability requires a user to take some action before the vulnerability can be exploited.
section_1_data.fixes: The fix for this vulnerability is not provided in the post.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36578 Microsoft Message Queuing Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Message Queuing (MSMQ) is affected by a Remote Code Execution vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-36578, with a CVSS score of 7.3/6.4. The vulnerability allows an authenticated domain user to remotely execute code on the target server, requiring user interaction for exploitation. The attack vector is local, and the attacker needs to convince a user to connect to a malicious server or compromise a legitimate MSMQ server host. The impact includes high confidentiality, integrity, and availability risks. Microsoft has provided a solution by releasing security updates for various Windows Server and Windows client versions. System administrators are advised to apply the relevant security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. Additionally, the Windows message queuing service needs to be enabled for a system to be exploitable by this vulnerability, and this feature can be added via the Control Panel. For more information on the affected products and specific build numbers, refer to the Microsoft Support Lifecycle and the provided security updates.
section_1_data.symptoms: An attacker can execute arbitrary code remotely by sending a specially crafted message to the Microsoft Message Queuing service.
section_1_data.fixes: The fix involves updating the Microsoft Message Queuing service to validate user-supplied input properly. This prevents an attacker from sending a message that the service executes as code.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36579 Microsoft Message Queuing Denial of Service Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Message Queuing is affected by a Denial of Service vulnerability identified as CVE-2023-36579, with a CVSS score of 7.5. The vulnerability allows an attacker to cause a total loss of availability, impacting resources managed by the same security authority. The attack vector is network-based, requiring no user interaction and no privileges. Microsoft has provided an official fix for this vulnerability through security updates for various Windows Server and Windows client versions, including Windows Server 2012, 2016, 2019, and Windows 10. System administrators are advised to apply the respective security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. The exploit code maturity is unproven, and the remediation level is an official fix. The vulnerability has been confirmed, and no active exploitation has been reported. For further details, refer to the Microsoft Security Updates page for the specific build numbers and update packages.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36584 Windows Mark of the Web Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows Mark of the Web Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-36584, affects various Windows versions, including Windows Server and Windows 10/11. The vulnerability allows an attacker to craft a malicious file that evades Mark of the Web (MOTW) defenses, leading to a limited loss of integrity and availability of security features such as Protected View in Microsoft Office. To exploit this, the attacker could host a file on a controlled server and convince a user to download and open it, interfering with the MOTW functionality. The vulnerability is rated as Important with a CVSS score of 5.4/5.0. Microsoft has provided a solution by releasing security updates for the affected Windows versions, addressing the Security Feature Bypass. System administrators are advised to apply the official patches or security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. The attack vector involves user interaction, and the exploit code maturity is functional. The remediation level is an official fix, and the report confidence is confirmed. For further details and specific build numbers, refer to the Microsoft Support Lifecycle page.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36572 Microsoft Message Queuing Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Message Queuing is affected by a remote code execution vulnerability identified as CVE-2023-36572. The attacker needs to convince a user on the target machine to connect to a malicious server or compromise a legitimate MSMQ server host and make it run as a malicious server. The attack vector is local, and user interaction is required for successful exploitation. The impact includes high confidentiality, integrity, and availability. System administrators are advised to apply the relevant security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. Additionally, the Windows message queuing service needs to be enabled for a system to be exploitable by this vulnerability, and this feature can be added via the Control Panel. For more information on the affected products and specific build numbers, refer to the Microsoft Security Updates page.

The attack complexity is high, requiring the attacker to win a race condition, and no user interaction is needed. Successful exploitation results in high impact on confidentiality, integrity, and availability. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by invoking the PrintHTML API from a locally running application or by tricking a user into doing so, allowing the attacker to launch an app via application protocols without prompting the user. Although the attack vector is local, the exploit is referred to as Arbitrary Code Execution (ACE). Microsoft has provided a complete vendor solution, and security updates have been released for all affected platforms, including Windows Server and Windows 10/11 versions. To stay fully protected, Microsoft recommends that customers who install Security Only updates also install the IE Cumulative updates for this vulnerability. The underlying MSHTML, EdgeHTML, and scripting platforms are still supported despite the retirement of Internet Explorer 11 and deprecation of Microsoft Edge Legacy. System administrators are advised to promptly apply the security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation.

System administrators are advised to apply the relevant security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information, refer to the Microsoft Security Update Guide.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-41772 Win32k Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: The Win32k Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-41772, affects various Windows versions, including Windows 10, Windows 11, and Windows Server. The vulnerability allows an attacker to gain SYSTEM privileges, potentially leading to unauthorized control over the affected system. The attack vector is local, with low complexity and no user interaction required. Microsoft has released security updates for the affected Windows versions, addressing the vulnerability and providing an official fix. System administrators are advised to apply the relevant security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. The CVSS base score for this vulnerability is 7.8, indicating a high severity level. The temporal score metrics confirm the availability of an official fix, reducing the urgency for immediate remediation. For more information and to download the security updates, refer to the Microsoft Support Lifecycle page.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-41773 Layer 2 Tunneling Protocol Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: A critical remote code execution vulnerability, CVE-2023-41773, has been identified in the Layer 2 Tunneling Protocol (L2TP) affecting various Windows Server and Windows client versions. The vulnerability allows an unauthenticated attacker to send a specially crafted protocol message to a Routing and Remote Access Service (RRAS) server, leading to remote code execution on the target machine. The attack complexity is high, requiring the attacker to win a race condition, and no user interaction or privileges are needed for exploitation. Successful exploitation results in a total loss of confidentiality, integrity, and availability. Microsoft has released security updates addressing this vulnerability for affected Windows Server and Windows client versions. System administrators are strongly advised to apply the provided security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information and to download the security updates, refer to the Microsoft Security Update Guide.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36725 Windows Kernel Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: A Windows Kernel Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-36725, has been reported with a maximum severity of 'Important'. The vulnerability allows an attacker to gain SYSTEM privileges, and it has a low attack complexity, requiring low privileges and no user interaction. The impact includes high confidentiality, integrity, and availability. Microsoft has provided security updates for various affected products, including Windows 10, Windows 11, and Windows Server versions, with build numbers 10.0.19045.3570, 10.0.22621.2428, 10.0.19041.3570, 10.0.22000.2538, 10.0.20348.2031, and 10.0.17763.4974. System administrators are advised to apply these security updates to mitigate the vulnerability. No workaround or temporary fix is mentioned, and the exploit code maturity is unproven, indicating no active exploitation at the time of publication.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36723 Windows Container Manager Service Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows Container Manager Service is affected by an Elevation of Privilege vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-36723, with a CVSS score of 7.8. The vulnerability allows an attacker to gain specific limited SYSTEM privileges. It has a low attack complexity and requires low privileges, with no user interaction needed. The impact includes high confidentiality, integrity, and availability. Microsoft has provided security updates for various Windows versions, including Windows 10, Windows 11, and Windows Server 2019/2022, with build numbers 10.0.19045.3570, 10.0.22621.2428, 10.0.19041.3570, 10.0.22000.2538, 10.0.20348.2031, and 10.0.17763.4974. System administrators are advised to apply the security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information, refer to the Microsoft Security Update Guide.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36594 Windows Graphics Component Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: A critical elevation of privilege vulnerability, CVE-2023-36594, has been identified in the Windows Graphics Component. The vulnerability allows an attacker to gain SYSTEM privileges, posing a high impact on confidentiality, integrity, and availability. The attack vector is local, with low complexity and no user interaction required. Microsoft has provided a complete vendor solution, addressing this vulnerability through security updates for various Windows Server and Windows client versions, including Windows 10, 11, and Server 2012 to 2022. System administrators are advised to apply the respective security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. The vulnerability could be exploited without any interaction from any user, making it crucial for organizations to prioritize the deployment of the official fix to prevent potential attacks. For further details and specific build numbers, refer to the Microsoft Security Update Guide.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36722 Active Directory Domain Services Information Disclosure Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Active Directory Domain Services is affected by an information disclosure vulnerability, CVE-2023-36722, with a CVSS base score of 4.4/3.9. The vulnerability allows an attacker to remotely exploit the network stack without user interaction, requiring high privileges. Successful exploitation could lead to the disclosure of sensitive information. Microsoft has provided an official fix for this vulnerability through security updates for various Windows Server and Windows client versions, including Windows Server 2008, 2012, 2016, 2019, and Windows 10 and 11. System administrators are advised to apply the relevant security updates to mitigate the risk of information disclosure. The high attack complexity and the potential impact on confidentiality make this vulnerability important to address promptly. For more information and specific build numbers for the security updates, refer to the Microsoft Security Update Guide.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36596 Remote Procedure Call Information Disclosure Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: CVE-2023-36596 is a Remote Procedure Call Information Disclosure Vulnerability affecting various Microsoft products, including Windows Server 2012, 2016, 2019, and 2022, as well as Windows 10 and 11. The vulnerability has a base score of 7.5 and a temporal score of 6.5, indicating a high severity. It allows an attacker to read small portions of heap memory remotely without requiring user interaction or privileges. Microsoft has provided a security update for all affected products, addressing the vulnerability. System administrators are advised to apply the respective security updates to mitigate the risk of information disclosure. The exploitability assessment indicates that the vulnerability is not publicly disclosed or exploited, making exploitation less likely. No specific workaround or mitigation beyond applying the official fix is mentioned. For more information and to access the security updates, refer to the Microsoft Update Guide.
section_1_data.symptoms: The vulnerability allows unauthorized attackers to disclose information via a network attack.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36598 Microsoft WDAC ODBC Driver Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft WDAC ODBC Driver is affected by a remote code execution vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-36598, with a CVSS score of 7.8. The vulnerability allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code with high impact on confidentiality, integrity, and availability. The attack vector is local, requiring user interaction, and has low attack complexity. Microsoft has released security updates for various Windows versions, including Windows 11, Windows Server 2022, 2019, 2016, 2012, 2008, and Windows 10 Version 1809. System administrators are advised to apply the provided security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. No specific workaround or mitigation other than applying the official fix is mentioned. For more information and to access the security updates, refer to the Microsoft Security Updates page.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36602 Windows TCP/IP Denial of Service Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: A Windows TCP/IP Denial of Service Vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-36602, has been reported with a maximum severity of 'Important'. The vulnerability is caused by a flaw in the Windows TCP/IP stack, leading to a high impact on availability. It is remotely exploitable without user interaction, making it a serious concern for networked services. Microsoft has provided a complete vendor solution in the form of security updates for various Windows versions, including Windows Server 2012, 2008, 2016, 10, and 11. System administrators are advised to apply the respective security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. The exploit code maturity is unproven, and the remediation level is marked as 'Official Fix', indicating the availability of patches. This vulnerability should be prioritized for immediate remediation due to its potential impact on network availability and the existence of confirmed technical details. For more information and specific update details, refer to the Microsoft Support Lifecycle page.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36603 Windows TCP/IP Denial of Service Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows TCP/IP Denial of Service Vulnerability (CVE-2023-36603) has been identified with a maximum severity of 'Important' and a CVSS score of 7.5. The vulnerability is caused by a flaw in the Windows TCP/IP stack, allowing an attacker to exploit it remotely without user interaction and with low attack complexity. This could lead to a total loss of availability, denying access to resources on affected systems. Microsoft has provided a security update (build numbers 10.0.19045.3570, 10.0.22621.2428, 10.0.19041.3570, 10.0.22000.2538, 10.0.20348.2031, 10.0.17763.4974) for various Windows versions, including Windows 10, Windows 11, and Windows Server 2019/2022, to address this vulnerability. System administrators are advised to apply the security update to mitigate the risk of exploitation. Additionally, a non-default firewall setting of 'EnablePacketQueue' can be used as a mitigating factor, which can be set through Intune/MDM or a group policy setting. For more information, refer to the Microsoft Security Response Center page for CVE-2023-36603.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36605 Windows Named Pipe Filesystem Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows Named Pipe Filesystem Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (CVE-2023-36605) has been identified as impacting various Windows versions, including Windows 10, Windows 11, and Windows Server. The vulnerability allows an attacker to gain SYSTEM privileges, posing a significant risk to the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of the affected systems. The attack vector is local, with high complexity and no user interaction required. Microsoft has provided a security update (build numbers provided) to address this vulnerability. System administrators are strongly advised to apply the security update to mitigate the risk of exploitation. The availability of an official fix indicates that system administrators should prioritize the deployment of the security update to affected systems. No specific workaround or mitigation other than the official fix has been mentioned.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36606 Microsoft Message Queuing Denial of Service Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Message Queuing is affected by a Denial of Service vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-36606, with a CVSS score of 7.5. The vulnerability allows an attacker to cause a total loss of availability without requiring user interaction. It impacts various Windows Server and Windows client versions. Microsoft has provided a security update to address this vulnerability. System administrators are advised to apply the relevant security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. The exploit code maturity is unproven, and the remediation level indicates that an official fix is available. The vulnerability has a confirmed report confidence, and no known exploitation has been disclosed. For more information and to obtain the necessary security updates, refer to the Microsoft Security Updates page for the specific affected products and versions.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36697 Microsoft Message Queuing Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Message Queuing is affected by a critical remote code execution vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-36697. The vulnerability allows an authenticated domain user to remotely execute code on the target server by convincing a user to connect to a malicious server or compromising a legitimate MSMQ server host. The attacker needs to exploit the Windows message queuing service, which must be enabled for a system to be vulnerable. The impact includes high confidentiality, integrity, and availability risks. Microsoft has provided a solution by releasing security updates for various affected Windows Server and Windows client versions. System administrators are advised to apply the relevant security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. Additionally, a mitigation involves checking if the Windows message queuing service is running and TCP port 1801 is listening on the machine. For more information, refer to the Microsoft Security Support Lifecycle page.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36698 Windows Kernel Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows Kernel is affected by a Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability (CVE-2023-36698) with a base score of 4.4/3.9. The vulnerability allows an attacker to bypass the Windows Arbitrary Code Guard exploit protection feature, potentially leading to some loss of integrity and availability. It has a low attack complexity and requires low privileges, with no user interaction needed. Successful exploitation could result in limited compromises to system integrity and availability. Microsoft has provided an official fix for this vulnerability. System administrators are advised to apply the security update to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information, refer to the Microsoft Support Lifecycle.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36701 Microsoft Resilient File System (ReFS) Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Resilient File System (ReFS) is affected by an elevation of privilege vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-36701, with a CVSS score of 7.8. The vulnerability allows an attacker to gain SYSTEM privileges without requiring user interaction. This vulnerability impacts various Windows Server and Windows client versions. Microsoft has provided a security update to address this vulnerability, available for different Windows versions including Windows Server 2012, 2016, 2019, and Windows 10. System administrators are advised to apply the provided security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. The exploitability assessment indicates that no exploit code is available, and the remediation level is marked as 'Official Fix', signifying the availability of a complete vendor solution. For more information and to download the security updates, refer to the Microsoft Security Update Guide.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36702 Microsoft DirectMusic Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft DirectMusic is affected by a remote code execution vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-36702, with a CVSS score of 7.8/6.8. The vulnerability allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code on the target system. The attack complexity is low, and no special privileges are required, but user interaction is necessary for successful exploitation. The impact includes high confidentiality, integrity, and availability risks. Microsoft has provided a complete vendor solution, and security updates are available for various Windows Server and Windows client versions. System administrators are advised to apply the relevant security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information on the affected products and specific build numbers, refer to the Microsoft Security Updates page.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36709 Microsoft AllJoyn API Denial of Service Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft AllJoyn API is affected by a Denial of Service vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-36709, with a CVSS score of 7.5. The vulnerability allows an attacker to cause a total loss of availability, impacting various Windows versions and server installations. The attack vector is network-based, requiring no user interaction and no privileges. Microsoft has provided a solution by releasing security updates for affected Windows versions and server installations. System administrators are advised to apply the relevant security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. The exploit code maturity is unproven, and the remediation level is an official fix, indicating the availability of a complete vendor solution. For more information, system administrators can refer to the Microsoft Support Lifecycle page.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36710 Windows Media Foundation Core Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows Media Foundation Core is affected by a Remote Code Execution vulnerability, assigned as CVE-2023-36710 with a CVSS score of 7.8. The vulnerability allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code remotely without requiring any user interaction. This vulnerability impacts various Windows Server and Windows client versions, including Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft has provided a security update to address this vulnerability, and system administrators are strongly advised to apply the relevant patches to mitigate the risk of exploitation. The exploitability assessment indicates that the attack vector is local, despite the CVE title indicating remote code execution, clarifying that the attack itself is carried out locally. The availability of an official fix reduces the urgency for interim remediation, and the confirmed existence of the vulnerability suggests a higher level of technical knowledge available to potential attackers. For more information and to download the security updates, refer to the Microsoft Update Guide at https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2023-36710.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36711 Windows Runtime C++ Template Library Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows Runtime C++ Template Library is affected by an elevation of privilege vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-36711, with a CVSS score of 7.8. The vulnerability allows an attacker to gain unauthorized access to resources managed by the same security authority. The attacker could exploit this vulnerability without any user interaction, potentially leading to total loss of confidentiality, integrity, and availability. An attacker who successfully exploits this vulnerability could create, delete, or move files in the security context of the 'NT AUTHORITY\LOCAL SERVICE' account. Microsoft has provided a security update for various affected Windows versions, including Windows Server and Windows 10, to address this vulnerability. System administrators are advised to apply the provided security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information and to download the security updates, refer to the Microsoft Security Update Guide.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36712 Windows Kernel Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows Kernel Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-36712, has been classified as 'Important' with a CVSS score of 7.8. The vulnerability allows an attacker to elevate privileges to the SYSTEM assigned integrity level. It requires user interaction, where the attacker must send a malicious input file and convince the user to open it. The impact includes high confidentiality, integrity, and availability. Microsoft has provided a security update for various affected products, including Windows Server 2012, 2016, 2019, Windows 10, and 11. System administrators are advised to apply the respective security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. The exploit code maturity is unproven, and an official fix is available, indicating the urgency of applying the security updates. For more information and specific build numbers, refer to the Microsoft Security Updates page.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36713 Windows Common Log File System Driver Information Disclosure Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows Common Log File System Driver is affected by an Information Disclosure vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-36713, with a CVSS base score of 5.5. The vulnerability allows an attacker to potentially read small portions of heap memory. It has a low attack complexity and does not require user interaction. The impact is limited to information disclosure, with no loss of integrity or availability. Microsoft has provided a complete vendor solution, and security updates are available for various Windows versions, including Windows Server 2012, 2016, 2019, and 2022, as well as Windows 10 and 11. System administrators are advised to apply the relevant security updates to mitigate the risk of information disclosure. For more information and specific build numbers, refer to the Microsoft Security Update Guide.
section_1_data.products: Windows Common Log File System Driver
section_1_data.symptoms: The vulnerability can be exploited locally, without user interaction, leading to information disclosure.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36717 Windows Virtual Trusted Platform Module Denial of Service Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows Virtual Trusted Platform Module (TPM) is affected by a Denial of Service (DoS) vulnerability identified as CVE-2023-36717, with a CVSS score of 6.5/5.7. The vulnerability allows an attacker to cause a total loss of availability, impacting various Windows versions, including Windows 10, 11, and Server editions. The attack vector is local, requiring low privileges and no user interaction. Microsoft has provided a security update (e.g., 5031362, 5031354) for affected Windows versions to address this vulnerability. System administrators are advised to apply the relevant security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. The exploit code maturity is unproven, and the remediation level is an official fix, indicating the availability of a complete vendor solution. For further details, system administrators can refer to the Microsoft Support Lifecycle page for software support lifecycle information.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36718 Microsoft Virtual Trusted Platform Module Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Virtual Trusted Platform Module is affected by a Critical Remote Code Execution vulnerability (CVE-2023-36718) with a CVSS score of 7.8. The vulnerability allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code in the context of the Virtual Trusted Platform Module. The attack vector is local, requiring no user interaction, and the attacker needs low privileges. Successful exploitation could lead to a total loss of confidentiality, integrity, and availability. Microsoft has released security updates for various Windows versions, including Windows 10, 11, and Server editions, addressing this vulnerability. System administrators are advised to apply the provided security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. No workaround or temporary fix is available, and the severity of the vulnerability necessitates immediate patching to prevent potential exploitation.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36720 Windows Mixed Reality Developer Tools Denial of Service Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: A Denial of Service (DoS) vulnerability, CVE-2023-36720, affects Windows Mixed Reality Developer Tools. The vulnerability has a base score of 7.5 and a temporal score of 6.5, indicating a high impact on availability. It is remotely exploitable with low attack complexity and does not require user interaction or privileges. The vulnerability affects various Windows versions, including Windows 10, Windows 11, and Windows Server. Microsoft has released security updates for the affected systems, addressing the vulnerability and providing an official fix. System administrators are advised to apply the relevant security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation and ensure the availability of the impacted components. For more information and to download the security updates, refer to the Microsoft Security Update Guide.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36721 Windows Error Reporting Service Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows Error Reporting Service is affected by an Elevation of Privilege vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-36721 with a CVSS score of 7.0. The vulnerability allows an attacker to gain SYSTEM privileges, and successful exploitation requires the attacker to win a race condition. The attack complexity is high, and no user interaction is required. The impact includes high confidentiality, integrity, and availability. Microsoft has provided an official fix for this vulnerability. System administrators are advised to apply the security update to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information on the fix and support lifecycle, refer to the Microsoft Support Lifecycle page.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-36592 Microsoft Message Queuing Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Message Queuing is affected by a remote code execution vulnerability identified as CVE-2023-36592, with a CVSS score of 7.3. The vulnerability allows an authenticated domain user to remotely execute code on the target server, potentially leading to a total loss of confidentiality, integrity, and availability. The attack vector is local, requiring user interaction, and the attacker needs to convince a user to connect to a malicious server or compromise a legitimate MSMQ server host. Microsoft has provided security updates for various Windows Server versions, including Windows Server 2012, 2016, 2019, and 2022, as well as Windows 10 and 11, to address this vulnerability. System administrators are advised to apply the security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. Additionally, enabling the Windows message queuing service needs to be carefully managed to reduce the severity of exploitation. For more information, refer to the Microsoft Support Lifecycle.
